relatedBlades.title: A guide for cyber readiness
relatedBlades.copy:
The cyber landscape is unpredictable, meaning we must always consider how to bolster defenses against a variety of attack types, either from nation-state groups or stand-alone cyber attackers.

Given the diversity of attacks, ensuring you have the necessary protections is critical, from network layer DDoS to a variety of application attacks. 
Please download our __Cyber Defense Rapid Response Guide__, outlining important actions to take over the next hour, day, week and month to improve your security posture. It also directs you to relevant  Cloudflare services to help you improve your cyber readiness quickly.

As a reminder, our team is always ready to lend a hand with your security posture.

features.title: DDoS attacks
features.description:
- [Application-layer DDoS attacks](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/application-layer-ddos-attack/): Cloudflare protects all customers by default with 121 Tbps of global network capacity.

- [Network-layer DDoS attacks](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/ddos/layer-3-ddos-attacks/#:~:text=Cloudflare%20Magic%20Transit%20is%20designed,these%20are%20layer%207%20only.): We closely monitor bigger, network-layer DDoS attacks looking to take down swaths of a company's network infrastructure. We recommend you have the proper network protections like [Magic Transit](https://www.cloudflare.com/magic-transit/) in place to ward off any network-layer DDoS attempts.

features.title: Web and application attacks
features.description:
- [Application vulnerabilities](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/what-is-web-application-security/): You are protected against application attacks and exploits with the [Cloudflare WAF](https://www.cloudflare.com/waf/).  This includes layered protections against OWASP Top 10 attacks along with more sophisticated exploits attempts such as Log4j via our managed rulesets.  

- [Automated traffic](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/bots/what-is-bot-management/): On any given day 30-40% of the internet is automated.  Manual mitigations used to stop bots only go so far before attackers adjust their techniques to evade them.  If you have questions about the amount of automated traffic your applications receive and how to address, your account team can assist.

- [Credential stuffing attacks](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/bots/what-is-credential-stuffing/): Bots are keen on credential stuffing.  To slow them in their tracks, please turn on our exposed credential checks ruleset in the [WAF](https://www.cloudflare.com/waf/) if you have not done so yet.  We also suggest using rate limiting to throttle abuse.

- [3rd party dependency risk](https://blog.cloudflare.com/page-shield-generally-available/): Attackers realize a direct way to compromise a web site is via third-party JavaScript the company doesn't own.  We suggest you gain an understanding of dependency risk by activating Page Shield Script Monitor, included for all customers.  Also please discuss additional Page Shield detections needed to secure web properties with your account team.

features.title: Attacks on your workforce and infrastructure
features.description:
- To prevent [Ransomware](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/ransomware/what-is-ransomware/) attacks, we recommend layering in [secure web gateway](https://www.cloudflare.com/products/zero-trust/gateway/) capabilities like DNS filtering and HTTP inspection to block known harmful content along with [remote browser isolation](https://www.cloudflare.com/products/zero-trust/browser-isolation/) to keep all malicious code far away from end user devices. 

- To mitigate the impact of ransomware, we recommend adopting [Zero Trust principles](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/glossary/what-is-zero-trust/) of least-privilege, default-deny access to prevent ransomware from moving laterally and escalating privilege across your network.

- Compromised [VPNs](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/access-management/vpn-security/) are increasingly common and can represent a single-point of failure to keep remote workers productive. We urge you to explore a [Zero Trust approach to application access](https://www.cloudflare.com/products/zero-trust/vpn-replacement/) that provides a more secure, faster way to connect users to corporate resources based on identity and other contextual signals.

- [API security](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/security/api/what-is-api-security/): Roughly half the traffic we see on the Cloudflare network is API-related. We urge you to review the number of API endpoints in production and consider your process for ongoing visibility and security for OWASP API top ten attacks.

- We also consider [advanced rate limiting](https://www.cloudflare.com/rate-limiting/) an important tool in protecting APIs when you match and limit traffic on API attributes like keys, cookies or tokens.

- [Attack surface risks](https://blog.cloudflare.com/security-center/): as a customer, please take advantage of [Cloudflare Security Center](https://www.cloudflare.com/securitycenter/) in your dashboard.  Security Center will let you understand attack surface risks in your Cloudflare infrastructure and address them in a few clicks.
